name: Fields and Fell Beck trail from Brimham Rocks

ai.summary: A 6.3 km moderate hike starting near Brimham Rocks, following the Fields and Fell Beck trail through moorland, grassy fields, and rocky outcrops with occasional stream crossings and gentle elevation changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect well-marked paths, stony tracks, and grassy field edges. The route includes uneven surfaces, rocky slabs near the rock formations at Brimham Rocks, and boggy patches after rainfall. Be cautious on wet sections and where Fell Beck crossings occur.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy hiking boots and weather-appropriate clothing; stay on marked paths and respect fences and farmland. Watch for uneven terrain, loose stones, and slippery rocks near water and rock features. Check the forecast and daylight hours; bring a map or offline navigation; keep children and dogs under control; take care around Fell Beck crossings as water levels can rise.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map or offline GPS and compass
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn (roughly April–October) generally offers milder weather and better visibility, though the hike is doable year‑round with proper gear.

seo.title: Fields and Fell Beck trail from Brimham Rocks – 6.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 6.3 km Fields and Fell Beck trail starting at Brimham Rocks. A moderate hike through moorland, rocky outcrops, and beck crossings in the UK.
